meanings.definition: To write or print (a letter or word) using the closest corresponding letters of a different alphabet or language.
meanings.sent1: I can transliterate the word 'hello' into Russian.
meanings.sent2: She needed to transliterate the Chinese characters into English for her report.
meanings.sent3: Trying to transliterate a whole sentence backwards can be quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players must transliterate ancient symbols to unlock the secret code.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to transliterate their names into hieroglyphics as a fun activity.

meanings.definition: To represent or spell out the letters of a word in another alphabet or language.
meanings.sent1: He had to transliterate his name into Arabic for the official document.
meanings.sent2: The software can automatically transliterate text from English to Hindi.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to transliterate the coded message to uncover the hidden clue.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to transliterate the poem into beautiful calligraphy.
meanings.sent5: The app allows users to easily transliterate text between different languages.
